availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Munroe (Hawkins Co. Tn, pvt 1st Ky. L. A.)

body.p: Hawkins County, Tennessee, student and soldier. Tennessee native. Son of Madison Munroe and Rebecca Munroe. Resident of Hawkins County, Tennessee, in 1850. Student in Hawkins County in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from December 4, 1863. Died of measles in military service at Point Isabel, Kentucky, on February 29, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Hawkins County, District 6, p. 325B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Hawkins County, District 6, p. 71.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 513.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0149.
